intro: Veronica teucrium proles chaixii, commonly known as the Chaix's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its stems are erect and branched. This species is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its environment.
